comment.author: 49015875@N00
comment._content: The eagle was later removed and she chnaged to US and the UK owners and changed her name see en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Imperator_%28ship%29

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The eagle's wings were torn off during an Atlantic storm, in early 1914. Rather than restore them, the company removed the entire figurehead.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Picture of figurehead (or possibly of a model) with wings: and one that is definitely on the ship

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The damage was on a trans-Atlantic crossing from Bremen to New York, arriving in New York on March 19, 1914. See next day's NYT: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F30716FD3A5B13738...

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks all, for your information on the figurehead and when it was damaged.  We will add some of it to the image description when we update.
